basic.description: A survey of the principal ideas of Western political theorists from ancient to modern times, focusing in particular on the role and scope of government; the proper organization of governmental power; the nature of political obligation; and the ethics of political power and authority.
basic.subject: POLS
basic.title: Political Theory

extra.enrollment_requirement:
PREREQUISITE    POLS 110/6.0. 
EXCLUSION    No more than 6.0 units from: PHIL 253/6.0; POLS 250/6.0.
